text: Regarding our talk of sponsor stuff to accelerate growth of the project gonna have to look into this: <https://techcrunch.com/2019/05/23/github-launches-sponsors-lets-you-pay-your-favorite-open-source-contributors/>

I added a manually created package.json file to the repo.

We are not using a build process, I manually wrote the file because GitHub gives us security benefits as well as we can get notifications on when dependencies are updated.

Right now there is only one true dependency on the project and that’s just a polyfill.
We also sort of depend on jQuery because HubSpot has it by default, but there’s not much point in us adding it as a dependency because HubSpot controls that for us.

>You can have the best open source project in the world but, if it doesn’t have good documentation, chances are it’ll never take off.
<https://css-tricks.com/front-end-documentation-style-guides-and-the-rise-of-mdx/>

So if you’re thinking, I don’t want to work on the documentation site, because it’s not as important, you’re wrong. Both the framework itself and the documentation site are equally valuable and necessary.
